meanings.definition: The act of bringing up or caring for offspring.
meanings.sent1: Her rearing of the baby birds was filled with love and dedication.
meanings.sent2: The rearing of children requires patience and responsibility.
meanings.sent3: The mama bear's rearing of her cubs was a heartwarming sight.
meanings.sent4: The rearing of a new generation is a vital part of the circle of life.
meanings.sent5: The rearing of young ones is a challenging but rewarding experience.

meanings.definition: The act of raising or lifting something up.
meanings.sent1: The rearing of the flag symbolized the start of the event.
meanings.sent2: His strong arms handled the rearing of heavy boxes effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The rearing of the trophy marked the end of the competition.
meanings.sent4: The rearing of the curtain signaled the beginning of the show.
meanings.sent5: The rearing of the banner caught everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: The act of nurturing or developing something.
meanings.sent1: The rearing of the plants in the garden required daily care.
meanings.sent2: His rearing of the business from scratch led to its success.
meanings.sent3: The rearing of the project from idea to reality was a team effort.
meanings.sent4: The rearing of a talent takes time and dedication.
meanings.sent5: The rearing of a dream involves hard work and perseverance.
